title: 112_s3077
content: The Act is titled the "Pro Football Hall of Fame Commemorative Coin Act" and includes findings related to the legislation. The Pro Football Hall of Fame's mission is to honor individuals who have made outstanding contributions to professional football, preserve historic documents and artifacts, educate the public about the sport's origin and promote its positive values. The Hall of Fame opened on September 7, 1963, enshrining a charter class of 17 players, coaches, and contributors including legends like Sammy Baugh, Red Grange, and Jim Thorpe. The Pro Football Hall of Fame opened on September 7, 1963, enshrining a charter class of 17 players, coaches, and contributors including legends like Sammy Baugh, Red Grange, and Jim Thorpe. There are 273 members in the Hall of Fame represented by a bronze bust, a gold jacket, and a ring. The museum has welcomed nearly 9 million visitors since its opening in 1963, expanding to a 118,000-square-foot facility through various expansions. The Pro Football Hall of Fame, opened in 1963, has grown to a 118,000-square-foot facility through expansions in 1971, 1978, 1995, and 2011-2013. The museum houses the world's largest collection on professional football, with over 20,000 artifacts and 20 million pages of documents. It reaches a global audience of nearly 15 million people annually. The Pro Football Hall of Fame has a vast collection of over 20,000 three-dimensional artifacts and 20 million pages of documents, including nearly 3 million photographic images. It reaches a worldwide audience of nearly 15 million people annually through various channels such as visitors to the museum, televised events, the Hall of Fame's website, and educational outreach programs. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins with specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins with specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions. The coins minted under this Act contain 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper, weigh 11.34 grams, have a diameter of 1.205 inches, and are legal tender. All coins minted under this Act are considered numismatic items. The design of coins minted under this Act shall represent professional football, with specific inscriptions and values. The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with relevant organizations and reviewed by a committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility for a 1-year period starting January 1, 2016. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price including the face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. Surcharges will also be applied. All sales of coins issued under this Act will include surcharges of $35 per $5 coin, $10 per $1 coin, and $5 per half-dollar coin. The surcharges received will be promptly paid to the Pro Football Hall of Fame for construction and renovation. The Hall of Fame will be audited for the amounts received. No surcharge may be included for the issuance of any coin under this Act. The Pro Football Hall of Fame will be audited for the amounts received under this Act. No surcharge may be included for the issuance of any coin if it exceeds the annual commemorative coin program issuance limitation. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance to enforce this limitation.
